head.title: National News Briefs; Compromise Is Sought In Delay of Clinton Case

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Government, Philanthropy and NGO

hedline.hl1: National News Briefs; Compromise Is Sought In Delay of Clinton Case

abstract.p: Arkansas special counsel Marie B Miller, who is seeking disbarment of Pres Clinton, says that she will oppose Clinton's lawyers' request for delay in proceedings unless Clinton agrees to resolve case before end of year (S)

block.p: A special counsel seeking the disbarment of President Clinton said today that she would oppose any delay in the proceedings unless Mr. Clinton agreed to resolve the case before the end of the year.

Mr. Clinton's response to the disbarment suit is due on Monday. This week, his lawyers asked for a 30-day extension, citing the president's involvement in the Mideast peace talks at Camp David and the economic summit in Okinawa, Japan.
A special counsel seeking the disbarment of President Clinton said today that she would oppose any delay in the proceedings unless Mr. Clinton agreed to resolve the case before the end of the year.

Mr. Clinton's response to the disbarment suit is due on Monday. This week, his lawyers asked for a 30-day extension, citing the president's involvement in the Mideast peace talks at Camp David and the economic summit in Okinawa, Japan.

The counsel, Marie B. Miller, of the Arkansas Supreme Court Committee on Professional Conduct, said she would normally accommodate such a request. ''It is in the interest of all parties to complete the trial of this matter prior to Dec. 31, 2000,'' she said.
That date would be three weeks before Mr. Clinton is to leave the White House, but it is also the day that the term of the presiding judge in the disbarment case ends.

The presiding official, Judge Leon Johnson, must decide whether to grant a delay in the disbarment case, which resulted from Mr. Clinton's admitted effort to mislead lawyers in the Paula Jones sexual harassment case about his involvement with Monica S. Lewinsky.
